summary: Onebit is being rebuilt from scratch as a calm, minimal focus web app that works stably without live LLMs by default. The core flow is fixed (Landing → Mental Dump → Context Snapshot (blocker+time) → deterministic Focus Compression → Action Mode (single task + client timer) → Manual Check-in → deterministic Recovery (micro-steps) → Session End → light Session History). The product is local-first with optional opt-in backend sync (Motoko backend optional). LLM integration is strictly backend-only, disabled by default, limited to Focus Compression + Recovery (max 3 calls/session), and must always fallback to deterministic rules on error/timeout. Required additions include demo mode with 3 canned sessions, an admin private panel for backend-only OPENAI_API_KEY plus demo video link + pitch text, accessibility + Grok/Calm-inspired theme, and exporting sessions as .txt, with build notes documenting LLM hooks and safe enablement.

existing_features.title: Guided focus-session flow (multi-step UI)
existing_features.description: Implements a 7-step session journey in the frontend (landing, mental dump, context selection, AI task generation, check-in, recovery, session end) using local state to control navigation and persist session data across steps.

existing_features.title: Mental dump capture
existing_features.description: Provides a large textarea for users to write everything on their mind; requires non-empty input before advancing to the next step.

existing_features.title: Context and time-available selection
existing_features.description: Collects the user’s current focus challenge and available time via radio-group options, enforcing selection of both before continuing.

existing_features.title: AI focus task generation with timeout/retry
existing_features.description: Starts a backend session, calls the backend to generate a focus task (OpenAI chat completions), enforces a ~35s client-side timeout, retries once at the mutation layer, and displays loading/error states.

existing_features.title: AI response parsing and error classification
existing_features.description: Parses OpenAI JSON responses when available, extracts the assistant message, removes trailing `.semanticDot`, normalizes punctuation, validates minimum length, and maps backend/service errors into user-facing messages (including admin-only configuration errors).

existing_features.title: Fallback task suggestions when AI is unavailable
existing_features.description: When AI generation fails (non-admin errors), the frontend selects a suggested fallback task and continues the session flow, communicating the degraded mode to the user.

existing_features.title: Recovery step generation after ‘stuck’/‘avoided’ outcomes
existing_features.description: After a negative outcome, generates a smaller next step via AI (with the same timeout/error handling) and enforces an AI call limit (max 3 per session) before forcing a fallback suggestion.

existing_features.title: Session outcome capture and completion messaging
existing_features.description: Allows users to mark the outcome (completed/stuck/avoided) and displays an appropriate completion message; persists outcome and end timestamp to backend on session end.

existing_features.title: Backend session lifecycle API
existing_features.description: Motoko canister supports starting sessions, updating task text, updating outcome, ending a session (timestamp), and listing all sessions.

existing_features.title: Internet Identity authentication and actor management
existing_features.description: Provides an Internet Identity provider with login/logout and identity persistence; creates an authenticated or anonymous backend actor and refreshes react-query data when identity changes.

existing_features.title: Role-based access control with admin bootstrap secret
existing_features.description: Implements admin/user/guest roles in the backend. The first principal presenting the correct secret (matched against `CAFFEINE_ADMIN_TOKEN`) becomes admin; admins can assign roles and access admin-only endpoints.

existing_features.title: Admin-managed OpenAI API key storage and verification
existing_features.description: Backend supports storing an OpenAI API key (admin-only), verifying that a key is set (trap-based), and using the stored key to authorize OpenAI outcalls.

existing_features.title: User profile storage (authorized)
existing_features.description: Backend supports saving and retrieving user profiles keyed by principal text, with authorization rules (users access own; admins can access others).

existing_features.title: ICP HTTP outcalls wrapper for external APIs
existing_features.description: Provides helper functions for HTTP GET/POST outcalls with cycle allocation, standard headers (User-Agent, Idempotency-Key), and a transform function that strips response headers.

existing_features.title: Calm-themed UI system and notifications
existing_features.description: Tailwind + OKLCH calm palette styling, animated transitions, and user notifications via sonner toasts; ThemeProvider is included (light by default).

existing_features.title: Safe JSON construction for OpenAI requests (escaped user input)
existing_features.description: Backend builds OpenAI request bodies via structured JSON construction/encoding (instead of string concatenation) so user-provided text (mental dump/context/duration/recovery framing) is correctly escaped and cannot break or alter the payload.

existing_features.title: Session privacy + caller-based authorization enforcement
existing_features.description: Backend enforces caller/identity authorization across session lifecycle and session reads so users can only create/read/update/end their own sessions; admin-only access is required for global session listing (or equivalent restriction).

existing_features.title: Stable persistence for admin-stored OpenAI API key across upgrades
existing_features.description: Backend stores the admin-managed OpenAI API key (and other critical state as needed) in stable storage with migration support so the key persists across canister upgrades.

existing_features.title: Admin API key clear/rotate operations + configured/not-configured UX
existing_features.description: Admins can clear or rotate the stored OpenAI API key (including intentionally setting it to empty/none) and the frontend provides a clear configured/not-configured state and configuration flow consistent with the admin role model.

existing_features.title: RecoveryPage “I’ll try this” continues without ending the session
existing_features.description: RecoveryPage no longer ends the session when the user selects “I’ll try this”; ending occurs only via an explicit “End session” action.

existing_features.title: Context-aligned fallback task mapping
existing_features.description: Fallback task suggestions map to the actual context values used by the UI (e.g., overwhelmed/unclear/distracted/tired/anxious), ensuring context-appropriate fallbacks when AI calls fail.

existing_features.title: Responses-style OpenAI response parsing support
existing_features.description: Frontend parsing supports newer Responses-style outputs (e.g., preferring `output_text` when present) while preserving existing error classification behavior and fallback behavior.

existing_features.title: Implement the Onebit core flow exactly as: Landing → Mental Dump → Context Snapshot (blocker + time) → Focus Compression (deterministic) → Action Mode (single task + client timer) → Manual Check-in (done/stuck/avoided) → Recovery (micro-steps) → Session End → Light Session History, ensuring each screen presents a single primary decision/action and uses English for all user-facing text.

Implement deterministic Focus Compression as the default behavior in both frontend and backend: split mental dump by lines (and common separators), score candidates (verb + urgency + shortness), prefer candidates that fit the selected time bucket (10/20/30 minutes), and return exactly ONE primary action plus an optional fallback action.

Implement deterministic Recovery Logic as the default behavior in both frontend and backend: for outcome “stuck” return exactly 2 micro-steps; for outcome “avoided” return a neutral reframe plus exactly 2 micro-steps and an explicit option to end the session; keep language non-therapeutic, non-motivational, and minimal.

Add a client-side timer in Action Mode (runs entirely in the browser) that supports start/pause/reset and matches the selected time bucket; the timer must not require backend calls and must not be affected by LLM availability.

Implement Demo Mode with exactly 3 canned sessions and zero API calls (no OpenAI calls and no backend dependency), and ensure the full flow is usable in demo mode from Landing through History and export.

Implement local-first session storage: store session drafts and completed sessions on the client (persisted across reloads), and add an opt-in toggle for backend sync that, when enabled, syncs sessions to the Motoko backend; when disabled, the app must not require authentication or backend availability.

Add Light Session History UI showing recent sessions (local-first, optionally merged with backend-synced sessions when enabled), including: timestamp, chosen one action, outcome, and (if present) recovery micro-steps/next step; provide a “Start new Onebit” entrypoint from History.

Implement export of session history as a plain .txt file generated in the browser (no backend), including the key fields for each session in a readable format; the export must work in demo mode and offline.

Make LLM integration optional and disabled by default: add a clearly labeled admin-controlled setting that enables/disables LLM usage, enforce a maximum of 3 LLM calls per session, and always fall back to deterministic Focus Compression and deterministic Recovery Logic on error/timeout; restrict LLM usage to only Focus Compression and Recovery.

Enforce strict OpenAI security and output constraints: OpenAI requests must be made backend-only and only if OPENAI_API_KEY is configured in the backend; never store or expose the key in frontend state, logs, or UI; ensure any LLM output is at most 1 sentence, neutral, and contains no therapy/motivation, greetings, or self-referential AI language.

Extend the private Admin panel to (a) manage OPENAI_API_KEY (existing) and (b) attach a demo video link (60s) and pitch text stored in backend state; expose these two fields to the Landing page for display without exposing admin-only controls to non-admin users.

Accessibility and UI theme: apply a Grok + Calm inspired (reference-only) minimal theme consistently across all pages, maintaining strong contrast, keyboard navigation, visible focus states, and clear typography; keep the UI calm and sparse with one decision per screen.

Add a short build notes document in-repo that explains: (1) where deterministic Focus Compression and Recovery Logic live, (2) where the optional LLM hooks live, (3) how to enable LLM safely (admin steps, key configuration), and (4) how the max-3-calls-per-session and fallback behavior are enforced.

Builder check / unsupported capability handling: if “backend secrets (project settings)” cannot be programmatically written by the app, keep the admin “paste API key” flow as canister-stored secret (admin-only) and document this as the closest safe alternative while still preventing exposure to the frontend.

new_feature_requests.summary: Adapt OpenAI integration/prompting to Onebit’s website flow (single focus task + recovery step) using the newer OpenAI Responses-style request/response format (conceptually), while keeping keys managed server-side
Adjust AI prompts/responses to better fit Onebit’s website format (single focus task + recovery/therapy-style step), updating the generated outputs accordingly
Update the UI look/feel and flow presentation inspired by xAI Grok and Calm.com, while keeping the same underlying Onebit session format/steps

Regenerate/rebuild the Onebit app from scratch end-to-end (fresh build), incorporating the updated OpenAI integration, adjusted responses, and Grok/Calm-inspired UI while keeping the same underlying session format

Rebuild OpenAI backend integration to reliably use the admin-stored API key (persist across upgrades), always include required `model`, and send `Authorization: Bearer ...` on every request; optionally align request/response shape with OpenAI Responses API style while keeping the Onebit flow

Update the backend OpenAI HTTP outcall integration to align conceptually with the OpenAI “Responses API” style: send requests to the Responses endpoint, include a required `model`, always send `Authorization: Bearer <admin-stored-key>`, and return a response shape the frontend can reliably parse for the generated task text.

Adjust the prompting and generated outputs to fit a “one thing + recovery therapy” tone: generate exactly one concrete focus task (short, actionable, time-bounded) and, when needed, generate a smaller recovery next-step that is supportive, non-judgmental, and grounded—without verbose explanations or self-referential AI text.

Redesign the UI look-and-feel inspired by xAI Grok and Calm.com (reference only) while keeping the same Onebit step format and underlying flow (landing → mental dump → context/time → action → check-in → recovery (optional) → end). Apply the new visual system consistently across all pages.

Rebuild Onebit from scratch to implement the exact required core flow (Landing → Mental Dump → Context Snapshot → Focus Compression → Action Mode + timer → Manual Check-in → Recovery → Session End → Light Session History) with a single decision per screen
Implement deterministic FocusCompression logic (split/score lines, match time bucket, return ONE action + optional fallback) as the default behavior (no LLM required)
Implement deterministic RecoveryLogic: for “stuck” return 2 micro-steps; for “avoided” provide reframe + option to end; keep outputs short/neutral
Add demo mode with 3 canned sessions and zero API calls for reliable offline/stable behavior
Implement local-first session storage with optional opt-in backend sync (Motoko backend optional), plus light session history and export sessions as .txt

Add a private admin panel to manage backend-only OPENAI_API_KEY (never exposed to frontend/logs) and to attach a 60s demo video link + pitch text; include documented LLM hooks (disabled by default) with strict limits (FocusCompression+Recovery only, max 3 calls/session, fallback to deterministic on error/timeout, 1-sentence neutral output)

architectural_notes: Frontend is a React SPA with an explicit multi-step flow state machine in App.tsx (landing → mental dump → context → action → check-in → recovery → end).
Frontend uses @tanstack/react-query for all backend reads/mutations, including cache invalidation and refetching when the authenticated actor changes.
Internet Identity integration is encapsulated in a React context provider (AuthClient), with identity persistence across reloads and a custom login status state machine.
Backend is a Motoko canister actor (ICP) using a migration hook pattern `(with migration = Migration.run)` and in-memory Maps for sessions and user profiles.

Authorization is implemented via a mixin (`MixinAuthorization`) and an `access-control` module mapping Principals to roles (admin/user/guest). Admin bootstrap uses an environment variable token plus a user-provided secret.
Sensitive bootstrap secret (admin token) is read from URL hash and persisted in sessionStorage, then removed from the URL via history.replaceState to reduce leakage.
OpenAI integration is done via ICP HTTP outcalls (management canister `IC.http_request`) with a transform function that strips response headers.

AI responses are post-processed on the frontend (parseAIResponse) to handle OpenAI JSON format, strip a required `.semanticDot` suffix, normalize punctuation, and classify error modes (admin key error vs service error).
UI styling uses TailwindCSS with a custom OKLCH “calm” design token palette and next-themes ThemeProvider (forced light by default), plus shadcn/ui-style components and sonner toasts.
Resilience patterns include explicit 35s timeouts for AI calls, limited retries (react-query mutation retry=1), and fallback task suggestions when AI is unavailable.
known_issues: Two CSS entrypoints are present in the repo dump (`frontend/src/index.css` and `frontend/index.css`); only `src/index.css` is imported, but duplication may cause confusion/drift.
Outcall cycle budget is a fixed constant; failures due to insufficient cycles or oversized responses are not explicitly handled (max_response_bytes is null).

OpenAI requests are intermittently failing due to missing required request fields (e.g., `model`) and/or missing `Authorization: Bearer <key>` header; key storage/lookup may be inconsistent between deployments, leading to 'AI key missing/invalid' and 'API key not found' errors.

AI integration reliability is currently unstable (repeated failures across focus-task generation), indicating the backend may not be consistently using the admin-stored key and/or not persisting it correctly across rebuilds/deploys.
